results.title: Bellingcat: Truth in a Post-Truth World
results.creator_credit: Submarine, Hans Pool, Femke Wolting and Bruno Felix
results.brief_description: A first-hand look into the revolutionary rise of the “citizen investigative journalist” collective known as Bellingcat.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Submarine, Hans Pool, Femke Wolting and Bruno Felix
results.description: A first-hand look into the revolutionary rise of the “citizen investigative journalist” collective known as Bellingcat. Comprised of various distinct personalities from around the globe, Bellingcat is an online association of talented and dedicated truth-seekers utilizing advanced digital research techniques to upend the world of journalism. De facto leader Eliot and his fellow researchers give us exclusive access into their tight-knit world as they demonstrate the unlimited power of open source investigation. In cases ranging from the MH17 disaster to the hidden crimes of the Syrian regime, the group’s power and growing global influence is examined and explored.
description_for_label: A first-hand look into the revolutionary rise of the “citizen investigative journalist” collective known as Bellingcat. Comprised of various distinct personalities from around the globe, Bellingcat is an online association of talented and dedicated truth-seekers utilizing advanced digital research techniques to upend the world of journalism. De facto leader Eliot and his fellow researchers give us exclusive access into their tight-knit world as they demonstrate the unlimited power of open source investigation. In cases ranging from the MH17 disaster to the hidden crimes of the Syrian regime, the group’s power and growing global influence is examined and explored.

results.title: Becky Sharp
results.brief_description: Adapted from a play that drew inspiration from William Makepeace Thackeray’s novel “Vanity Fair”, the film explores the English class system during the era of the Napoleonic Wars, but more importantly, is the first feature to use three-strip Technicolor.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Evolution of colour
constellations_other.description: From stenciling film frames through to the survival of Technicolor after Hollywood stopped using it, this Constellation links early cinema to some of the world's greatest films.

results.description: The first feature length film to use three-strip Technicolor film. Adapted from a play that was adapted from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the Napoleonic Wars era.
description_for_label: The first feature length film to use three-strip Technicolor film. Adapted from a play that was adapted from William Makepeace Thackeray’s book “Vanity Fair”, the film looks at the English class system during the Napoleonic Wars era.

results.title: Beavis and Butt-head
results.creator_credit: Film Roman Productions, MTV Animation, J.J. Sedelmaier Productions, Paramount Television Studios, Judgemental Films Inc., Tenth Annual Industries, Ternion Pictures and Mike Judge
results.brief_description: Beavis and Butt-head are high school students whose lifestyles revolve around TV, junk food (usually nachos), shopping malls, heavy metal music, and trying to “score with chicks”. Each show contains short cartoons centering on the duo who live in the fictitious town of Highland, Texas. The episodes are broken up by short breaks in which Beavis and Butt-head watch and make fun of music videos.

constellations_other.name: Horror movie right there on my TV
constellations_other.description: The colourful and quirky music video for Skyhooks’ song 'Horror Movie' helped propel them to number one, making it their biggest hit.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Roman Productions, MTV Animation, J.J. Sedelmaier Productions, Paramount Television Studios, Judgemental Films Inc., Tenth Annual Industries, Ternion Pictures and Mike Judge

results.title: Bear
results.creator_credit: Helen Frank, Elizabeth Mary Moore, Paul Katte and Nick Nicolaou
results.brief_description: Jack means well, but sometimes good intentions have horrible consequences.

constellations_other.name: The Lumière brothers
constellations_other.description: The Lumière brothers understood the potential of cinema to be exhibited theatrically. Only one person could watch films through Thomas Edison's Kinetograph, while Auguste and Louis exhibited their films to thousands with Cinematographe.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Frank, Elizabeth Mary Moore, Paul Katte and Nick Nicolaou
results.description: Jack means well, but sometimes good intentions have horrible consequences.
description_for_label: Jack means well, but sometimes good intentions have horrible consequences.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resultant public demonstration, showing support, which brought on a police massacre. The film had an incredible impact on the development of cinema and is a masterful example of montage editing.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

results.description: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resultant public demonstration, showing support, which brought on a police massacre. The film had an incredible impact on the development of cinema and is a masterful example of montage editing.

results.brief_description: While Batman deals with a deformed man calling himself the Penguin, an employee of a corrupt businessman transforms into the Catwoman.

results.title: Basic Instinct

results.headline_credit: France and United States of America, 1992
results.brief_description: A violent police detective investigates a brutal murder that might involve a manipulative and seductive novelist.

constellations_other.name: Screen story searching
constellations_other.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

results.title: Barbarosa
results.creator_credit: William D. Wittliff, Fred Schepisi, Alliance, Incorporated Television Company (ITC) and Paul N. Lazarus III
results.brief_description: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.creator_credit_for_label: William D. Wittliff, Fred Schepisi, Alliance, Incorporated Television Company (ITC) and Paul N. Lazarus III
results.description: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher. Don Braulio wants Barbarosa dead for marrying his daughter against the father’s will. Barbarosa reluctantly takes the clumsy Karl on as a partner, as both of them look to survive the forces lining up against them.
description_for_label: Karl Westover, an inexperienced farm boy, runs away after unintentionally killing a neighbor, whose family pursues him for vengeance. He meets Barbarosa, a gunman of near-mythical proportions, who is himself in danger from his father-in-law Don Braulio, a wealthy Mexican rancher. Don Braulio wants Barbarosa dead for marrying his daughter against the father’s will. Barbarosa reluctantly takes the clumsy Karl on as a partner, as both of them look to survive the forces lining up against them.

results.title: Band of Brothers
results.creator_credit: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To, Erik Jendresen, BBC Television Centre and Playtone
results.brief_description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: HBO Films, DreamWorks Television, HBO, DreamWorks Pictures, Stephen Ambrose, Gary Goetzman, Erik Bork, Tony To, Erik Jendresen, BBC Television Centre and Playtone
results.description: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.
description_for_label: Drawn from interviews with survivors of Easy Company, as well as their journals and letters, Band of Brothers chronicles the experiences of these men from paratrooper training in Georgia through the end of the war. As an elite rifle company parachuting into Normandy early on D-Day morning, participants in the Battle of the Bulge, and witness to the horrors of war, the men of Easy knew extraordinary bravery and extraordinary fear - and became the stuff of legend. Based on Stephen E. Ambrose’s acclaimed book of the same name.

results.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
results.brief_description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

results.description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.
description_for_label: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages. In the United States, the “Pyjamas” in the title was modified to reflect the American spelling pajamas. This aired in syndication from 1995 to 1997 as a half-hour series, then became a 15-minute show paired with a short-lived 15-minute series The Crayon Box, under a 30-minute block produced by Sachs Family Entertainment titled Bananas in Pajamas & The Crayon Box. Additionally, the characters and a scene from the show were featured in the Kids for Character sequel titled Kids for Character: Choices Count. The pilot episode was Pink Mug.
